properties.areaDesc: Jackson; Douglas; Osage; Shawnee; Franklin; Wabaunsee; Lyon; Jefferson; Morris; Anderson; Coffey
properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 9 at 9:42PM CST until January 11 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Topeka KS
properties.description:
...Dangerous Travel Conditions Likely Friday Afternoon through
Saturday...

A strong storm system will approach the region late tonight into
Friday with rainfall overspreading much of northeast and east
central Kansas. Temperatures will rapidly fall during the
afternoon and evening hours Friday, transitioning precipition to
a wintry mix of freezing rain and sleet. All precipitation is
expected to transition to snow by sunrise Saturday morning, with
periods of moderate to heavy snow continuing through Saturday
afternoon.

* WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation possible. Total snow
accumulations of 3 to 5 inches and ice accumulations of around
two tenths of an inch possible. Winds could gust as high as 35
mph.

* WHERE...Portions of east central and northeast Kansas.

* WHEN...Rain on Friday transitions to a wintry mix from
northwest to southeast during the late afternoon to evening
hours. There will likely be a break in the precipitation Friday
night, with a second round of moderate to heavy snow setting in
early Saturday morning. This snow will last through Saturday
afternoon.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing
snow could significantly reduce visibility.
properties.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON
